item.title: The Wiire Podcast - Episode #169
item.itunes:author: The Wiire
item.itunes:subtitle: In part 2 of our E3 2010 coverage, Scott Barkman returns to voice his opinions on the Nintendo 3DS and nearly every game he could get his hands on, including Zelda: Skyward Sword, Mario Sports Mix, Wii Party, Goldeneye 007, ...
item.itunes:summary: In part 2 of our E3 2010 coverage, Scott Barkman returns to voice his opinions on the Nintendo 3DS and nearly every game he could get his hands on, including Zelda: Skyward Sword, Mario Sports Mix, Wii Party, Goldeneye 007, Epic Mickey, Kirby's Epic Yarn, Metroid: Other M, Donkey Kong Country Returns, and much more. Don't miss this episode, download today!
item.description:
In part 2 of our E3 2010 coverage, Scott Barkman returns to voice his opinions on the Nintendo 3DS and nearly every game he could get his hands on, including Zelda: Skyward Sword, Mario Sports Mix, Wii Party, Goldeneye 007, Epic Mickey, Kirby's Epic Yarn, Metroid: Other M, Donkey Kong Country Returns, and much more. Don't miss this episode, download today!
  • Epic Hands-On Impressions from E3 2010
  • Epic Listener Mail

item.title: The Wiire Podcast - Episode #168
item.itunes:author: The Wiire
item.itunes:subtitle: Ian, Mike, and Andrew recap the biggest news coming from E3 this year, including Zelda: The Skyward Sword, Goldeneye 007 re-imagined for Wii, Kirby's Epic Yarn, Donkey Kong Country Returns, the Nintendo 3DS, and much more...
item.itunes:summary: Ian, Mike, and Andrew recap the biggest news coming from E3 this year, including Zelda: The Skyward Sword, Goldeneye 007 re-imagined for Wii, Kirby's Epic Yarn, Donkey Kong Country Returns, the Nintendo 3DS, and much more. We go over our reactions to the announcements (as well as those from Sony and Microsoft), and discuss where we think the industry is heading. Don't miss this episode, listen to it today!
item.description:
Ian, Mike, and Andrew recap the biggest news coming from E3 this year, including Zelda: The Skyward Sword, Goldeneye 007 re-imagined for Wii, Kirby's Epic Yarn, Donkey Kong Country Returns, the Nintendo 3DS, and much more. We go over our reactions to the announcements (as well as those from Sony and Microsoft), and discuss where we think the industry is heading. Don't miss this episode, listen to it today!

item.title: The Wiire Podcast - Episode #164
item.itunes:author: The Wiire
item.itunes:subtitle: Ian and Mike consist of the panel once again this week, and they take a look at Sakamoto's "four creative tenets of game design", WarioWare D.I.Y., Reggie's thoughts on Wii 2 (as well as a feature on the topic by Mike), the problems...
item.itunes:summary: Ian and Mike consist of the panel once again this week, and they take a look at Sakamoto's "four creative tenets of game design", WarioWare D.I.Y., Reggie's thoughts on Wii 2 (as well as a feature on the topic by Mike), the problems facing indie developers, and what EA Sports Active 2 comes bundled with. Plus, Cing declares bankrupcy, Sony announces PlayStation Move, Will Wright shares his thoughts on the Wii, and more of your listener mail is answered.
item.description:
Ian and Mike consist of the panel once again this week, and they take a look at Sakamoto's "four creative tenets of game design", WarioWare D.I.Y., Reggie's thoughts on Wii 2 (as well as a feature on the topic by Mike), the problems facing indie developers, and what EA Sports Active 2 comes bundled with. Plus, Cing declares bankrupcy, Sony announces PlayStation Move, Will Wright shares his thoughts on the Wii, and more of your listener mail is answered.

item.title: The Wiire Podcast - Episode #163
item.itunes:author: The Wiire
item.itunes:subtitle: Ian and Mike consist of the entire panel this week, and they sit down to talk about the general sense of aversion surrounding the Wii this week, including what Cammie thinks the biggest misconception about Nintendo is, Mario and Zelda...
item.itunes:summary: Ian and Mike consist of the entire panel this week, and they sit down to talk about the general sense of aversion surrounding the Wii this week, including what Cammie thinks the biggest misconception about Nintendo is, Mario and Zelda never appearing on Facebook, no price cut planned for 2010, Boom Blox developers laid off, and the Wii labeled as a "virus", not a games machines. Yikes! But it's not all bad news: Nintendo has surpassed the 10 million sales mark in Japan, Mega Man 10 gets Endless Mode, online gaming has increased 10% since last year, and EA Sports are still great believers in Wii. Plus, your hate mail.. er, listener mail!
item.description:
Ian and Mike consist of the entire panel this week, and they sit down to talk about the general sense of aversion surrounding the Wii this week, including what Cammie thinks the biggest misconception about Nintendo is, Mario and Zelda never appearing on Facebook, no price cut planned for 2010, Boom Blox developers laid off, and the Wii labeled as a "virus", not a games machines. Yikes! But it's not all bad news: Nintendo has surpassed the 10 million sales mark in Japan, Mega Man 10 gets Endless Mode, online gaming has increased 10% since last year, and EA Sports are still great believers in Wii. Plus, your hate mail.. er, listener mail!

item.title: The Wiire Podcast - Episode #162
item.itunes:author: The Wiire
item.itunes:subtitle: This week on The Wiire Podcast, Ian, Mike, and Andrew are told yet again that a successor to the Wii isn't coming "any time soon", footage is leaked (or faked) of Sonic 4, Sony files a baffling patent for a universal game controller, Ubisoft...
item.itunes:summary: This week on The Wiire Podcast, Ian, Mike, and Andrew are told yet again that a successor to the Wii isn't coming "any time soon", footage is leaked (or faked) of Sonic 4, Sony files a baffling patent for a universal game controller, Ubisoft says there's no point in making realistic games for Wii, and Disney wants to take Epic Mickey to "new levels" on the Wii. Plus, tons of your listener questions answered! Download this episode now!
item.description:
This week on The Wiire Podcast, Ian, Mike, and Andrew are told yet again that a successor to the Wii isn't coming "any time soon", footage is leaked (or faked) of Sonic 4, Sony files a baffling patent for a universal game controller, Ubisoft says there's no point in making realistic games for Wii, and Disney wants to take Epic Mickey to "new levels" on the Wii. Plus, tons of your listener questions answered! Download this episode now!

item.itunes:summary: This week, special guest Greg Tito from The Escapist joins a full panel consisting of Ian, Mike, Andrew and Scott to discuss the news of the week, including Miyamoto's comments on potential new Nintendo hardware, Sony's viewpoint on developers moving to the PS3, new details on Sonic 4 for WiiWare, Netflix HD streaming labeled "underwhelming", Nintendo fines a gamer $1.5 million for uploading a game, and much more, plus your listener mail! You won't want to miss this - download this episode today!
item.description:

You won't want to miss this - download this episode today!

item.itunes:summary: Ian, Mike, and Andrew recap the Wii news of the week, including Iwata's comments about how the sucessor to the Wii will need something else new besides HD, complete confusion over the availability of Metroid Prime Trilogy (and a bit of news regarding Metroid Other M), an M-rated game from Nintendo that has been in development for over three years, Monster Hunter Tri bundles, Zelda to be playable at E3 (and require Wii MotionPlus), and much more. Listen to this episode today!
item.description:
Ian, Mike, and Andrew recap the Wii news of the week, including Iwata's comments about how the sucessor to the Wii will need something else new besides HD, complete confusion over the availability of Metroid Prime Trilogy (and a bit of news regarding Metroid Other M), an M-rated game from Nintendo that has been in development for over three years, Monster Hunter Tri bundles, Zelda to be playable at E3 (and require Wii MotionPlus), and much more. Listen to this episode today!

Plus, more of your listener mail answered, more What Nintendo Heads Said, more (laughs), and more podcast - over an hour and a half to be exact! Don't miss this episode, listen today!
item.description:
What better way to ring in the new year by taking a look at the past year of Nintendo gaming? In this episode, Ian, Mike, Andrew and Scott select their picks for Game of the Year, and look ahead to the releases scheduled for 2010. Plus, more of your listener mail answered, more What Nintendo Heads Said, more (laughs), and more podcast - over an hour and a half to be exact! Don't miss this episode, listen today!

item.itunes:subtitle: This is the first podcast since E3 2006 and we decided to mix things up a bit. While the E3 attendees have spent the past two weeks voicing their opinions, the remaining staff has reacted to the hype and outpouring of Internet news and...
item.itunes:summary: This is the first podcast since E3 2006 and we decided to mix things up a bit. While the E3 attendees have spent the past two weeks voicing their opinions, the remaining staff has reacted to the hype and outpouring of Internet news and video. Nintendo's slogan might be "playing is believing", but only a select few from around the world were able to try the system out. Listen to professional analysis of how the world watched and heard the reactions of the gaming journalists inside E3 2006 and Nintendo's press conference. So download, sit back, and relax. Podcast #28 is here!
item.description:
This is the first podcast since E3 2006 and we decided to mix things up a bit. While the E3 attendees have spent the past two weeks voicing their opinions, the remaining staff has reacted to the hype and outpouring of Internet news and video. Nintendo's slogan might be "playing is believing", but only a select few from around the world were able to try the system out. Listen to professional analysis of how the world watched and heard the reactions of the gaming journalists inside E3 2006 and Nintendo's press conference. So download, sit back, and relax. Podcast #28 is here!
  • Impressions from the sidelines: an analysis of E3 2006 based on the staff's reported coverage.
  • The Internet reacts: the public responds to the event.
  • What's next? - Nintendo had a strong show, but how are they going to follow this up to keep momentum strong?

item.itunes:summary: Delivered like fresh rolls from an oven, Podcast #024 is here! Sadly, this podcast ends the Revolution Report podcasts, discussing the change to our new name, The Wiire (pronounced "wire"). The new name will take effect to the new podcasts immediately, and the site will slowly but surely alter its name as well. In the meantime, our staff comments on several games lined up for the system, including Hudson's flight game, the accelerometer in the Nunchuk, memory chips ordered, and more! Quit reading, start downloading!

item.description:
Revolution Report has picked up the pace and is glad to present you with podcast episode #012! In this edition, the discussion falls on the approaching launch of the Xbox 360 as well as the recent launch of the Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection, and what both mean for Nintendo?s next-generation console.
  • NPD sales charts: PS2 version of Resident Evil 4 underperforms in its first week.
  • Media Create sales charts: DS "table-game" compilation grabs #2 spot.

  • Club Nintendo offers Revolution-inspired television remote.
  • Square-Enix considers multiplatform strategy for Dragon Quest and Final Fantasy.
  • Electronic Arts and SEGA to follow in Valve's digital distribution footsteps.
  • The Xbox 360 launch date is quickly approaching. How has the online community and consumers in general responded to the new console? What does the Xbox 360's level of success at launch mean to Nintendo and what steps might Nintendo be taking to ensure Revolution has a successful launch?
  • Mario Kart DS recently launched to critical acclaim, and although the online system is functional, it possesses some flaws. Is the game indicative of what we?ll see from online games on Revolution? What are the expectations for an online-enabled console with the success of Xbox Live?

  • Pros/Cons of Revolution controller and possible attachments.

item.description:
After weeks of struggle and strife in the last few podcasts, the Revolution Report team has finally redeemed itself with podcast #006! Some heated discussion and two intelligent listener questions make this the best podcast so far! Check out the show notes below for an overview of all the topics within.
  • Take-two lowers projections a Bully slips to '06.
  • News Corporation to acquire IGN in $650 million deal
  • Monkey Ball rolling onto Nintendo DS.
  • Marvel acquires new credit, plans to produce ten new movies, and most likely 10 new games as well.
  • GDCE '05 a huge success as attendance figures double
  • The SEC approves merger of GameStop and Electronics Boutique
  • TGS Floor plan
  • Former World of WarCraft Staff Found Red 5 Studio
  • Gamasutra Question Of The Week Revisits PSP, DS Battle
  • PSP sales in UK 185,000 on first 2 days
  • Nintendo ventures into mobile phone market in Japan PSP sells 185,00 in launch weekend-what does this mean for the DS and Nintendo's future control of the handheld market?
  • Pictures of Leipzig Gaming Convention Available -- Exclusive content is good!

item.title: Revolution Report Podcast - Episode #005
item.itunes:author: The Wiire
item.itunes:subtitle: Hot off the presses and on time! Enjoy your Revolution Report and be scared as Raging Rob pays a visit to the panel. For more information on anything we discussed, simply check out the show notes below.
item.itunes:summary: Hot off the presses and on time! Enjoy your Revolution Report and be scared as Raging Rob pays a visit to the panel. For more information on anything we discussed, simply check out the show notes below.
item.description:
Hot off the presses and on time! Enjoy your Revolution Report and be scared as Raging Rob pays a visit to the panel. For more information on anything we discussed, simply check out the show notes below.
  • Nintendogs has sold a quarter million in the first week
  • Wealth of new Xbox 360 information is revealed
  • Hundreds line up as PSP launches in the UK
  • Gizmondo to get full GPS mapping suite next month
  • Former EA employees establish new development studio
  • Sony slings mud at Microsoft and Nintendo
  • World of Warcraft hits 4 million subscribers
  • Sega announces new arcade board and games
  • Namco-made Mario Kart playable at JAMMA
  • Nintendo buying back 1.5% of their shares, what could this mean? Preventing what problems?
  • Colors, colors, colors. Our color blues continue with the SP receiving new colors, but none for DS.
  • Sony officially slings mud, while a Sony exec decides to personally do it as well. We sound off on what they had to say.
  • We take a look at a poll in which 25% of voters believe Revolution controller will have a touch screen. We laugh.
item.author: questions@thewiire.com (The Wiire)

item.title: Revolution Report Podcast - Episode #004
item.itunes:author: The Wiire
item.itunes:subtitle: After much delay and anticipation, episode #004 is ready for download. Released along with its long lost brother #003, check out both casts for a total of nearly 2 hours worth of content. For more information on anything we discussed, simply...
item.itunes:summary: After much delay and anticipation, episode #004 is ready for download. Released along with its long lost brother #003, check out both casts for a total of nearly 2 hours worth of content. For more information on anything we discussed, simply check out the show notes below.
item.description:
After much delay and anticipation, episode #004 is ready for download. Released along with its long lost brother #003, check out both casts for a total of nearly 2 hours worth of content. For more information on anything we discussed, simply check out the show notes below.
  • No PlayStation 2 price cut before the holidays in Europe.
  • Resident Evil to the DS.
  • Chinese governmental plans on reducing MMO addiction.
  • Reports suggest Xbox 360 FFXI will require hard drive.
  • Tecmo confirms support for PlayStation 3.
  • Nintendo's Perrin Kaplan dismisses Microsoft's chances in Japan.
  • More PSP peripherals enter the market for launch, and a discussion of the proper pronunciation of "peripherals".
  • Halo movie now set to launch in 2007?
  • Square Enix might take control of 67% of Taito for a whopping $606.4 million. What would this mean for gamers, and more importantly what would their name be?
  • We love Nintendogs! Will these types of "non-games" be a staple on the Revolution? If so, to what degree?
  • Will the Revolution help push the industry closer to becoming more creative?
item.author: questions@thewiire.com (The Wiire)

item.description:
The long awaited and almost lost episode #003 is now officially released. Download and enjoy our editors in a roundtable type discussion on a variety of topics. For more information, check out the show notes below.
  • Europe to get pink and blue Nintendo DS consoles with launch of Nintendogs.
  • Xbox 360 price, and accessory pricing confirmed - $299 & $399
  • Ubisoft pledges support for Revolution
  • Infinium Labs, creator of the Phantom console, to move to Seattle; Bachus named as CEO as part of a major restructuring
  • Nintendo launches new GameCube hardware bundles for USA and Europe.
  • Legendary Tetris creator Alexey Pajitnov signs with WildSnake for game collaboration.
  • DS and PSP instant-messaging software in development
  • Poll results discussed.
  • What will we see at launch? Mario, Metroid, or Zelda?
  • Zelda Delayed! How will this affect the launch of Revolution?
  • Does Nintendo really only care about making the game better, or are there bigger reasons for the delay?
  • Xbox 360 pricing and package deals. Will we see similar moves with Revolution?
  • The newly announced $129 DS, and its future user base. What could this mean for future connectivity?
